Description: Pottery Tell El-Yahudiyeh ware juglet; wheel-made; cylindrical neck flaring slightly to rolled rim; vertical handle from below rim to shoulder; piriform-ovoid body; button base; decorated in three vertical zones seperated by incised lines, with alternating plain areas and closely spaced, punctured chevrons; traces of highly lustrous burnishing; fabric dark grey with red core; small chip missing from rim; hole in body.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Enkomi
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (C103)
Kaplan 1980 / The Origin and Distribution of Tell el Yahudiyeh Ware. (P. 277, Fig. 56.b)
